conclusion: Understand the geometry of the problem.
ABC is a square with side length R, AC is an arc with radius R, O is the center.
The refractive index of the material is n = 2.
Calculate the critical angle using sin θc = 1/n.
For n = 2, sin θc = 1/2, therefore θc = 30°.
Determine incident angle range where light cannot exit directly.
Incident angle must be greater than 30° with respect to the normal.
Total angle subtended by arc AC at center O is 90°.
Angle range where light cannot exit is 30° to 90°, which is 60°.
Convert angle to arc length: 60° corresponds to πR/3.
The length of the arc where light cannot exit is πR/3.
